title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is a structured method of assessing a candidate's qualifications, skills, experience, and fit for a particular role or organization. It typically involves several stages and can vary in length and format depending on the company and the position being filled. Here is a general overview of the interview process:
Interview Questions: By following these steps, an admissions counselor can help a student in need of financial aid navigate the complex process, access available resources, and make informed decisions about financing their education.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was a quick and straight forward. Since this is just an assistant position, all you really need is a grasp on customer service and who to direct more complicated questions to
Interview Questions: One thing I was asked in the interview was a situation. “If a student came in with a question and the phone started ringing, how would you go about prioritizing your tasks”

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was good until the 3rd round. I was interrupted during my presentation by the hiring manager. Definitely a flag. Also, I wasn't given the correct instructions for my presentation.
Interview Questions: How long had I been working in my positions?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: Zoom meeting. Campus visit. Tour of the campus. Meet the faculty and Dean. Sample lecture. A presentation about how you would maintain your professional work outside of the teaching requirements and how they would benefit the students.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be here? What would be your goals outside of teaching? How will your outside activity contribute to the students?

title: Clinical Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview thirty minutes On-campus interview eight hours. Pick up from my hotel Teaching presentation Research presentation Meetings with chairs Meetings with deans Lunch with other professors Interesting questions Q and A sections Campus tour Drop off at my Hotel
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in KSU?

title: Senior Financial Aid Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Rome, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview process. I received clear communication prior to the interview and was asked to create a presentation relevant to the job. Parking can be tricky so do your research beforehand. There was a 5 person committee and after they asked questions, I gave my presentation. Everyone was very welcoming and it was a great experience.
Interview Questions: They asked questions about my general experience and specific questions relating to my knowledge on the duties of the role.

title: Application Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: Met with two staff members. Interview took about an hour. pretty standard interview, nothing technical. After about 4 weeks of not hearing anything I followed up to see what the status of the position was. Didn't hear anything. About 2.5 months later I got an automated email from HR saying the position wasn't going to be filled. An annoying waste of time with no courtesy on KSU's end.
Interview Questions: Very standard. Can't remember the questions but that's cause it was so normal.

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty quick, you have to do an initial skills assessment which you will be given 3-hrs to finish. After is the interview, which is just one round where you meet with the entire team and present what you created during the assessment.
Interview Questions: What is your design process like? Why do you want to work for us? How do you ensure you stay on trend? Your experience with print projects? How well do you manage multiple projects?

title: CRM Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: The initial step was a phone screening and then after that no one ever returned my calls or emails. Pretty disappointed in the correspondence after the phone screening and am honestly shocked at the unprofessionalism.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about yourself?

title: IT Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Great. Had an interview after applying online. Needed to have an understanding of IT support ton assist with infrastructure support and Customer service to attend to the needs of individuals. The interviewer was friendly and professional.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really straightforward and simple. Everything was online during COVID peak. There were a lot of people present for the interview which was surprising. The interview lasted about an hour. It took months to get any response from HR and was shocked it was an offer.
Interview Questions: A time you overcame negative team dynamics?

title: Graduation Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was fine, structured by meeting students and staff, then direct coworkers, then the director. The issue came in when I asked the director (Dr. Lyons) how much the salary would be. She told me $56k. 2 weeks later, I got called and offered the job, but they stated after running me through an “experience calculator” they would only offer me $42k. $14,000 is far too much taken from the initially discussed salary. Further, I was directly misled by the director. She never once mentioned an experience calculator or anything, she explicitly said “the salary will be $56k.” I know there was another contender, but they must have turned down the measly salary as well, because the job was just posted on LinkedIn again. Don’t fall for it, value yourself.
Interview Questions: General questions regarding working with students and how to assist them in various ways.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview process. Discussed with the department and met with professors. Most of it was making sure the professors in the e department found you to be a good fit as well as having a professor needing an assistant.
Interview Questions: Why i wanted the position.

title: Technical Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process involved four other person and asked questions related to printer, laptop, PC, and OS.
Scenario question as well such as "Client is having issue with a local printer. What are your steps in troubleshooting this problem?"
Interview Questions: What is your expected salary?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Quick and Easy. Interview was very short, the staff just wanted to know about prior experience as well as what my future goals were. The staff was very nice, and I have been enjoying the experience so far.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work at KSU.

title: Part-time Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was the easiest process in terms of getting hired. I was offered the job on the spot. I immediately accepted the position. I began working with a month.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at KSU

title: Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interviews were very professional, honest, and informative.  A good variety of questions were asked including behavioral and situational ones. I was left with a good understanding of the roles of team members and what was expected from the person who would step in to the position of Director of Development.
Interview Questions: Explain the process of how you dealt with a difficult donor and obtained a major gift from that donor

title: Museum Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview discussing my background as an educator, and the role of Holocaust education in Georgia's curriculum. They asked about my comfort traveling and presenting in front of large groups of children, as well as why I chose to focus my career on museum education
Interview Questions: Why do you think museum education is important?

title: Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions:
5 panel interview - virtual 
Required an assignment/presentation...
Applied online and recieved an email request for interview maybe a week later.
Interview felt casual, very comfortable atmosphere.
Received rejection email one week later.
Interview Questions: Casual conversation mostly, one creative thinking question at the end.

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had to speak about my portfolio, showing it on a big flat screen TV. I had to answer questions from the panelist. It took about an hour. If chosen, the next step is a three hour design assessment.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? Are you a member of any graphic design groups in your area?

title: Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: This was a long drawn out process. After the 4th interview never heard anything- ever. Was told I would  hear something after an extensive interview process. They don’t seem to be organized.
Interview Questions: My experiences/ panel interview-typical questions

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: First interview was a video call with the Hiring committee. Second was to create a presentation for a 4 phase interview (hiring committee, department wide presentation, assistant director 1:1, executive director 1:1).
Interview Questions: To create a presentation explaining the department offerings and why other campus units should partner with the career departments.

title: Financial Aid Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: Initial Phone Screen, In person interview with some of the team members and the Asst Directors  (panel style) . The questions were fairly easy to determine your knowledge of enrollment services
Interview Questions: When you looked on our website, what did you find?

title: Course Based Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Teams meeting with two people. I applied months earlier but waited for the new semester to start. Work began a week or two later. Overall it was an average experience.
Interview Questions: What is your motivation to stop cheating?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Online coding interview and ask for previous work experience, projects related to coursework.
Given some situations and ask how did you react and perform to those. 
How do you help students in different situations?
How can you able to collaborate with your team?
Timings to teach.
Interview Questions:
Online coding interview and ask for previous work experience, projects related to coursework.
Given some situations and ask how did you react and perform to those. 
How do you help students in different situations?
How can you able to collaborate with your team?
Timings to teach.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process depends on the department in which you are applying. For me the Interview process was in two stages and was not very difficult. The whole process took around 3 days and an offer was made to me which I accepted happily
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself

title: Assistant Professor, Entrepreneurship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: They are very friendly. I interviewed  with 4 people including Dr. Young, Dr. Brouthers Dr. Quinet. They ask about your research story, how your background can contribute to that major. They asked about teaching philosophy.
Interview Questions: 1. your research for the future.

title: Upper Level Accounting Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA)
Interview Descriptions: The group interview was a little stressful.  The heads of about 6 or 8 different departments were present.  I initially had a one-on-one interview, but the second interview was opened up to the department heads.  Each manager asked several questions.  Everyone was friendly, but I was a little nervous.
Interview Questions: How would you handle certain situations with employees.  I can't recall the specifics.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: 1 Interview asking about previous work experience, skills and how you can contribute to the team. They explain the job position to you and ask if its something you can handle.
Interview Questions: - Tell me about a time you've had a difficult interaction with a customer.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: After completing the application, I was contacted by email to set up a telephone interview with the Office Manager. I spoke with the Office Manager and the next day, had another phone interview with the second highest in the department. After that, I was brought in to interview with Office Manager and three other people from the department.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize your day?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted to set up a phone interview. The bulk of the interview questions took place over the phone and then I was invited to an in person meeting. This involved meeting the Department Chair and co-Chairs, various faculty, and seeing the department's offices, classrooms, and other facilities.
Interview Questions: Describe an instance where you helped a faculty member with something they needed.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: After applying online, I had a phone interview. This lasted only a few minutes, during which I was directed to set up for payment with HR. This was followed by a short orientation session. We began training shortly after. There was very little difficulty getting this position
Interview Questions:
What makes you a good fit for this position?
Do you have good soft skills?
Are you familiar with our department?
What makes you want to work with us?

title: Social Media Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: They asked the basic interview questions, they ask about your professional experience and personal questions to get to know you better. It was about 30 minutes long and a very simple process.
Interview Questions: What do you like to do in your free time?

title: Assistant Vice President Budget and Planning Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was inititally called for an interview with HR and about a week later, I had a panel phone interview that lasted about 30 minutes. They seemed to be engaged and when I asked the CBO about next steps, I was told originally that I would be brought on campus for a tour of the campus and another  interview. Within 3 seconds of the statement, she got quiet and changed course and said EITHER I would be brought on campus for a tour OR I would hear from HR. Needless to say, it's been almost 2 weeks and it's been radio silient.  I sent the customary thank you for the interview and I haven't heard a peep from them. While I know that everyone is busy, if you know that you're going to hire someone else or you don't like the current candidate, it would be nice to hear back one way or the other.  This is very unprofessional especially when I was given the impression that I would be moving on to the next stage of the interview process.
Interview Questions: What is the largest budget that you have been responsible for?

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: It was a nice interview. It started off with a first round phone interview then an on campus interview where I met some of the people I will be working with in the future.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years is the question they asked me along the tradition leadership style, professional development, my experience, internships/co-ops etc.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was panel style with about 5-7 employees. They  asked questions about my experience and  asked me to expound upon my resume.  The interview last maybe 25 minutes. I was also asked questions about the Kennesaw State University community
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interviews by three petiole and just told them about myself and my school schedule with an upbeat tone and they fit me in where they had an opening I was interested in.
Interview Questions: What is your school schedule?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for an interview shortly after submitting my application online. The interviewer was casual and friendly, and the questions were simple. At the end of the interview, I was hired.
Interview Questions: What are three words your best friend would use to describe you?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions:
Straight forward. Gave great insight into what kind of job you applied for. Interviewers are always nice and respectful. 
Provided in great detail, what student assistant duties will be. 
Gave time to think about if the position is still a good fit for the applicant. Gives answers on spot.
Interview Questions: questions pertained more to "what kind of person are you".

title: Flight Crew Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a really laid back interview. I knew the people who were at the interview asking the questions. I didn't feel any pressure going into the. I was very excited from the job.
Interview Questions: Why did you want this job?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very fast. The atmosphere is supportive and informal. Responses from admin and management are quick and everyone is helpful.The manager and coworkers are great people to work with. It is a great resume builder and very flexible for students. It can be hectic sometimes but the team is always there to help.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Marietta, GA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Brief and relaxed interview. She asked about my hobbies, background, goals, and was a really smooth and personal conversation overall. I believe that helped create a good relationship with the interviewer.
Interview Questions: What are you goals after graduation? What other jobs did you have previously?

title: Part-Time Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Informal phone interview. Went pretty well. Straight forward and informally salary was offered for the semester. Good questions. Flexibility to choose course.the whole conversation lasted for about 20 minutes. Have chances to think over the opportunity
Interview Questions: Offered to teach the available courses. Got idea of salary for each course per semester

title: Order Fulfillment Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: It was basically a group interview where you would get called on to answer random questions. Pretty easy and straightforward. There was about 15 people at the interview and you get paid for training/orientation.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a difficult or angry customer?

title: History Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Quick and painless, the interview included an online questionnaire to see some basic personality traits. After that, it was an interview on site for about 30 minutes that ended with me getting the job.
Interview Questions: When can you work?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: It varies from department to department, but make sure to know basic interview questions. The questions won't be anything too in depth.  Just make sure to dress business casual and give a good presence.
Interview Questions: What are you studying and why?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Most times are usually pretty easy and calm experience. They get back to you within a couple of days. and most time can start working the following week. Sometimes the background check may take a while to get back before starting
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: MY PROFESSOR ASKED general my educational background and interest on reaserch and my maths skill and cryptography siklls  and  my interest in presenting reaserches which are done and doing serveys on already done papers
Interview Questions: what type of programming language confortable

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: It's an all day affair in which I was left in an empty office in between meetings and just expected to sit there. Weird interviews with the Dean and Associate Dean in which I was asked why AI won't take over a library by the dean and then asked to prove why I would stay in the job for 5+ years by the associate dean
Interview Questions: Why will AI take over a library and how do we stop it?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Marietta, GA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process didn't take much long. I found the job opening through handshake and applied. The next week they interviewed me. I interviewed the chair of the department. He was a nice guy, and after that introduced me to the professor i will be dealing with. It took about an hour.
Interview Questions: What is your level of education? Why are you interested in this department?

title: Student Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: Spoke to a professor to ask about being a student assistant, was directed to the administrator for the department. Purely informal for the interview to discuss major, expected graduation, who/what I want to help, familiarity with chosen curriculum for the lab.
Interview Questions: What grade did you get in this course when you took it? How long ago?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted within a week by phone. The interview was very easy and relaxed. They asked me questions that they had already prepared. They wanted to know my background and about my previous jobs. They asked my major and how i think how this job would help with it. They wanted to know my schedule and availability. I interviewed with three people.
Interview Questions: How does this job intermix with your major?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: A phone interview was conducted prior to my face-to-face interview. The interview process was comprised of a panel of advisors  from the dept. and a faculty member. It took about 1.5 hours.
Interview Questions:
Advisors at times must deliver 'bad news' about graduation or petitions, etc..
Describe a time you had to deliver bad news and how the student received it.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Marietta, GA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very fast, when you apply in between semesters when people graduate. Since I was already working on campus and knew the manager, I was able to ask her in person if they were hiring
Interview Questions: Are you able to lift a 50 lbs table?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Calm, fast and easy.
There were 9 members of the administration sitting in front of me and each one had several questions to ask. Those questions were related to my background, my education and my motivation to work with them.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have for this Job?

title: Statistics GTA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my Grad School Application, I was contacted based on my resume. I was asked to come in for an interview with my supervisor and a current GTA. I knew that I had the job before I left the interview.
Interview Questions: What do you find the most difficult about teaching?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Application and interview process moved quickly and was upfront about low salary/no negotiating.  Panel phone interview then 2 weeks later invited in for a full day (8 hours) interview, including a presentation, panel interviews, one on on interviews, and tour. (no travel reimbursement) Was told decision would be made by the end of the week, but over a month later (and many ignored emails) I got an email from HR saying they'd decided not to hire anyone. I am an alum and I had an "in" within the department. So definitely confusing and not very professional on their end.
Interview Questions: How is your closet organized?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted by email to set up phone interview about two weeks after the posting closed. We spoke about the position, salary, and my experience with teaching. We then set up an in person interview. Very relaxing getting to know you and my experience with the subject I would be teaching. I was then shown around the building.
Interview Questions: What classes have I taught before and how did I enjoy teaching.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Marietta, GA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: In order to get the job, after applying online, if selected you'll have to face a personal interview and a group activity. In the personal interview you will be interviewed by three people at once, each one will ask 2 questions and then will ask you if you have any question. This process is repeated three times; each interview lasts 10 minutes for a total of 30 minutes. The same day you are requested to attend a group activity during the evening in which they will judge you outside before even beginning the whole event, and then inside the room where ice-breakers will take place. At the end there will be free time to talk to everybody and your relational skills will be judged.
Interview Questions: How would this position affect you as a student?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview is based on “STAR” method. Describe a SITUATION, tell what TASKS you needed to complete in the situation, what ACTIONS you took, and what the RESULTS turned out to be.
Interview Questions: They had interviewees complete a list where they put  a list of priorities in order based upon what item they would complete first if all were happening at the same time.

title: Economics and Finance Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It wasn't really an interview. I met with the head of the tutoring department and we talked about my availability and which classes I felt comfortable tutoring. There was a form for me to fill out with my GPA, which classes I had taken and the grades I had made, and a few additional short questions.
Interview Questions: How would you help a student that is struggling with a particular topic?

title: Substitute Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was nice....nice school the interview process is just like any other interview process they ask you questions then you answer....simple then you play the waiting game to see if you’ll be hired like all other interviews
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself?

title: Student Affairs Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Search committee response was fast. Honest about salary/low pay. Invited for campus visit (travel reimbursement included). Presentation topic provided a little late. Two weeks later received an automated HR response that I did not qualify as a next stage candidate - very odd. Emailed regarding process and reimbursement and received no response. Highly unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years...

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: congenial, met w many faculty  used power points in large auditorium. Given topic in advance. Process was transparent at each phase. Phases seemed efficient.  One on with w dept chair and with dean. Would have liked to see a actual class in session. Was not aware of emphasis on scan trons
Interview Questions: Group of profs sits in room and asks fairly easy questions. Describe research, teaching style, reaction to cheating student, etc  Took me to lunch and gave me campus tour. One on one with dept chair and with dean

title: Order Fulfillment Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Whether you visit the store or call, they will direct you to their online site to fill out the application. They just sat us all in a room and told us about the position. There was no real interview. I think it's a little different now though. 
They only hire at the beginning and end of the semester.
Interview Questions: There were no real questions

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was not an interview. They just asked your availability and why you want to be a student assistant. Very easy. I would not recommend working for this team. The head coach has serious anger issues. I am pretty sure this program will tank, while taking everyone down with it. Just be careful. It looks great on a resume for anyone interested in the sports business.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Administrative Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a phone call about 3 weeks later inviting me to a phone interview with multiple people that lasted about 30 minutes.  About 2 weeks later, I was invited back for an on campus interview with multiple people that lasted about 30 minutes and followed by an administrative task using a computer.  I was called by HR about 2 weeks after that and was offered the job.  Be sure to review HR's website - there is a wealth of information that gave me a lot of insight into the process, the pay, and policies.
Interview Questions: Typical workplace questions: What are your strengths?  Why do you want to work at KSU?  What is your experience working with Windows/Office/etc.?  What is your compensation requirements?

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was swift. I was able to apply through the KSU careers portal with my resume, transcripts and cover letter. I was contacted by the head of the department for a phone interview and shortly thereafter I was offer the opportunity to teach 1 class part time on campus.
Interview Questions: How many years of experience do you have in the field and what qualifies you to teach this class?

title: Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: I was given some general questions to be prepared to answer on the day of my interview.  They were mainly behavioral questions.  I first spoke with the director of the department.  I then had a conversation with one of the assistant directors.  I was called in to interview three days later.  The interview was a panel interview of three people.  It was laid back, I felt no level of intimidation or uneasy with the personalities or questions.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a time when you....  what did you intend to accomplish when.... what were the results of....?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Fairly laid back and routine interview.  Opened with small talk with the usual transition to standard interview questions regarding my past professional experiences.  There was also a query as to what transpired that is leading me to seek new employment.
Interview Questions: Walk me through your resume highlighting some of the accomplishments you are most proud of in each role.

title: Assistant Professor, Economics and Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview.  I don't remember all of the questions, but they were standard questions about why I wanted the job and my prior experience.  They asked for references and wanted to know why I wanted to work in this department.  I met with several employees and was given a tour of the office.
Interview Questions: What is your work ethic like?

title: Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was thorough because the interviewer was prepared, knew what to ask, took a lot of notes. I interviewed with the prospective supervisor, the supervisor's supervisor and then a panel.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about your background?

Tell me how you handled a stressful situation?

How do you think your experience will enrich this position?

Why are you the right candidate for this position?

title: STARS Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was referred then asked to fill out an application in which an interview followed. The referral was based on my year in school as well as seen skills that would ideally match the role of assisting the director on the trip. It was later that week that I was contacted and asked a few questions. The application was fairly simple and the follow up even simpler.
Interview Questions: Do you have an International Experience ?

title: Academic Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very thorough and professional. The interviewer was polite and gave plenty of opportunity for me to ask any questions I thought of. I was able to gain a lot of knowledge about the UNiversity, and get a good feel for how the work flow would be in the position I applied for.
Interview Questions:
What makes you qualified for this position

How would you calm an angry customer

What would you do if there was a question you could not answer

Where do I see myself in 5 years

title: Emergency Management Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Received a call from HR to schedule an interview. Drove to Georgia and spent the night (paid for my own travel). The next day I had my interview and it took about 15-minutes and after they asked me to tell them about myself they said I had covered all the questions. A few weeks later I received a generic HR email saying they went with another candidate.
Interview Questions: Scenario Questions

title: Fitness Coordinator Contract Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was not hard as I was a contractor trying to obtain new fitness classes. It did require a demonstration of my class performance and also a detailed resume of my fitness experience. Upon being hired, you will be required to provide your current fitness class certifications, your American Heart Association or Red Cross CPR certification, as well as professional liability insurance coverage.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions expect for how do you handle difficult participants that don't adhere to instruction.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Apply on school website for open GRA positions, interviews are like any other employment, discussions to see if you will work well with the Professor you will be assigned to for compatibility and so they may choose the best candidate for their needs.
Interview Questions: Will researching a subject that you are not currently involved in be interesting enough to sustain the position?

title: Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Group interview, mock phone calls with current employees and management. They were judging how you interacted with the other people who applies. It is good to talk to everyone and be friendly. Talk with the hiring person as well.
Interview Questions: What difference will you make to the Alumni Association

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Questioner with the supervisor. I had to schedule an interview with supervisor of the place. Then I had to meet with the supervisor for the interview. Interview was mostly questions about your self and what work experience you had. After the interview I waited for the response on whether I got the job. Then I came in to train after I got the job.
Interview Questions: What are my skills like with people, and experience.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Marietta, GA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an application based on a recommendation of a current employee and was then called in for a Face to Face interview. Very laid back interview process.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work on campus?

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was sent out an email explaining that a department on campus was hiring and interested candidates should submit a resume and cover letter. I did so and came to the interview. There were five people present, all admins in the department, who asked various questions (detailed below). They were sweet and professional, and emailed me their decision a few days after the interview to offer me the position and set up a start date.
Interview Questions: How well do I know the campus, especially the locations of important offices like the Registrar, Financial Aid, advising offices for different majors on campus, department offices, etc.

title: Bookstore Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kennesaw State University in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by Human Resources to go to the interview. I got an appointment with the Store Manager. I was asked detailed and sales related, problem solving questions. There were the total of about 50 questions and they were all fairly easy to answer. Work ethic and attitude was also part of the process. At the end I was told by the hiring manager, that I was hired. I completed all necessery paperwork at the Human Resources.
Interview Questions: What was your most challenging work situation?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Marietta, GA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: 10 questions about yourself including your weakness and strengths; also ask for personal reference; multitask experience; assistant experience; previous job experience; why you want to work here. 10 questions about yourself including your weakness and strengths; also ask for personal reference; multitask experience; assistant experience; previous job experience; why you want to work here.
Interview Questions: your weakness and strengths

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Group interview and one one one interview that took all day to do. You spent the first half with groups left and then came back later to do a one on one with higher ups. the group interview was the most important and vital part.
Interview Questions: just personality based

title: PR Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and met with a panel for a 30-minute interview, followed by a writing test that involved reading a 35+ page document and creating a 2-3 page press release.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy and the interviewer was very friendly. Some questions included future aspirations, others were just on my past experiences and skills. Overall great experience. I don't know what else to write but I need to get to 50 words
Interview Questions: What do you want to do when you graduate collere?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: My interview was done by a panel of about five people, all who would be coworkers. After filling out an application they called to schedule, and it took about half an hour. After that it took about a week for them to get back to me to let me know whether I'd been hired. Thankfully, I was!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: After applying online, you'll get an email to sign up for a time if they choose to interview you. If they don't, you'll get a rejection email. I suggest keeping a look out for this email because times go quickly. The interview is 30 minutes in a solo interview with 3 different Senior RAs and 6 professional staff members. You'll start sitting in the middle of the room with the other candidates in your chosen time slot, and then you pick an interview table when prompted. You'll have about 5 minutes at the table with an RA and 2 pro staff members, then you'll move back to the middle of the room until the 5 minutes is up (if you finished early) and they're ready for another rotation. This happens to more times for a total of 3 tables visited. When I was hired, there was a group interview that was conducted by other RAs to evaluate leadership and teamwork, but they didn't do this in subsequent years. I also had to go to a social event with the other candidates and the RAs of that year. The interview process has changed every year, but the solo interview format has stayed the same and that is definitely the most important component.
Interview Questions: When have you experienced/dealt with diversity?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: very laid back and easy. Me and two other bosses. Got a call after submitting my resume, and came in the same day while also walking out with a job.
Interview Questions: what experience do you have in computer?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: Very simple asked me about my self and asked if I had any questions about the job. Knew a lot about the job before the interview, so it was very easy.
Interview Questions: Asked About self

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel review with 9 people sitting around a table. Very intimidating and impossible to keep up with perspectives of each of them, let alone their position within the hierarchy. Some behavioral questions were used. The criteria of the job was not emphasized.
Interview Questions: Behavioral question about difficult customers

title: Business Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview then in-person
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I saw that there was an opening through the website. Submit your resume/application. Wait for a call. If I had the right personality fit, then it was an immediate decision.
Interview Questions: What can you contribute to this department?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: A complete farce. A foregone conclusion cannot be overcome. In the process in which I was involved the decision of which applicant to hire was made before the job was even announced. It was abundantly clear that they were going through the motions rather than seeking to identify the most qualified person for the job. In this case, a person who was still in grad school when I started at KSU as an adjunct was given the post. My teaching and professional experience exceeds that of the person hired by nearly two decades. Not the fair process it is intended and mandated to be.
Interview Questions: What do you see yourself doing in five years? A most ridiculous question that never has a right answer.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online using the KSU careers site and got an interview a couple weeks later. The interview process was one-on-one and really easy - just basic interview questions. I was hired on the spot and could start as soon as all the HR paperwork went through. That took the longest amount of time but the manager was really sweet about it and let me get some training in before the new semester began and things were hectic.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my application online and within a week received an email to come in for an interview. The interview was conducted by two staff members and the questions were really directed at my communications skills and my ability to think on my feet. The next week I received a call saying I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: None. They were all pretty standard.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Simple interview, Simple process, they were looking for a student so that is what they got. After the 1:1, I met with the department and the other students. As soon as everything was done with human resources, I was able to start pretty soon. They want to make sure you are a good fit for the department and show responsibility to juggle your job and your schooling.
Interview Questions: Q. Strengths/ Weaknesses, Do you know how to do simple office work (answering phones, making copies), What is your school schedule like?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed in person at the Wellstar College and it was very simple and straightforward. The position was in the Deans office, so I spoke with the Dean's secretary. I was asked about my background and previous job positions. We talked about my educational and professional goals, and how I would be able to balance the job with my classes.
Interview Questions:
How do you stay organized?
Why should we hire you?

title: Manager/Supervisor III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial phone screen with the typical human resource questions.  That was followed up by an interview with 3 people from the department.  After that was completed there was one more additional interview that was one on one.  Once the I got the job offer I had to wait an additional week or so for the background check and credit check to come back.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you had an upset customer and how did you handle it?

title: Shift Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Upper management along with student managers arrive for a group interview. A series of questions that range from "personal" questions (see what your interests are, how you think, etc.). Followed by situational questions in the workplace that show how you would react in certain situations, based off of prior experiences.
Interview Questions:
"Name a difficult situation that you had faced, and describe how you arrived at a solution". 
"Describe yourself in 3 words"
"Why do you believe that you are the best option for this position?"

title: Clerical Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was immediate and smooth. The interview consisted of first a one to one session, followed by a panel with more supervisors. The interviewers were polite, and the expectation matched the job description. I would gladly work for this company in the future.
Interview Questions: What do you like about this organization?

title: Manager II Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: After applying for many jobs, I have had a few interviews two in person. The interviews I had on the phone ended with finding out they had hired who they had intended before the interview. It seems like a waste of time. I had one interviewer contact me after the interview and want my help after he interviewed me with no intention of hiring me.
Interview Questions: What is your budget?

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Pretty laid back, nice people. I had previously worked at the university in a different capacity. Made the transition to the new job easier. The overall job wasn't bad, but not the best. A bunch of underpaid people who all are trying to get promoted asap to a better hourly salary. I look back and laugh at my time there  cause the pay was so low, but yet i was so happy. Great job for a college kid but not a career type thing.
Interview Questions:
Last job you worked
why you left 
why you would be a good fit here
are you a people person and why

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: 1:1 interview in person
Interview Questions: have any DB experience? and data mining?

title: Senior Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: I submitted application in response to online ad. I had an initial phone screen with hiring manager. That was followed by interview with the hiring manager, director of Information Technology and CIO.
Interview Questions: None. Very general questions about experience.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kennesaw State University (Kennesaw, GA) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: Very short interview process. It lasted only one day, so there was very little time to really get to know people and ask questions. I met with the chair, the associate dean, had to give a presentation to the departmental faculty, and just saw individual faculty members from time to time. Had dinner with the search committee. Was required to teach one class on the same day as the interview. I would have liked to have had time to speak with individual faculty on a one-on-one basis, as well as talk with students one-on-one.
Interview Questions: What is your research agenda?
